ICISMPDeviceExtension Class Reference

This class extends ICISMPDevice by adding interface methods to send and receive data.

This class has not to be used directly by applications since it does not open a Companion session itself. It provides an API for sending and receiving data to the classes that implement a raw communication channel,like ICTransaction and ICSPP. These two classes inherit from ICISMPDeviceExtension and can therefore call its methods to send/receive data.

More...

#import <ICISMPDeviceExtension.h>

Detailed Description

This class extends ICISMPDevice by adding interface methods to send and receive data.

This class has not to be used directly by applications since it does not open a Companion session itself. It provides an API for sending and receiving data to the classes that implement a raw communication channel,like ICTransaction and ICSPP. These two classes inherit from ICISMPDeviceExtension and can therefore call its methods to send/receive data.

Method Documentation

- (int) SendData: (NSData *)  Data

Send a data buffer synchronously.

This method writes the NSData object provided in argument on the output stream of the SPP channel, and returns the number of bytes that have been written. This method is to be used in a context where the data is sent synchronously, like in a loop for example. This means that the application should implement a loop an continue calling SendData until all the data is written to the terminal.

Parameters
DataA NSData object containing the data bytes to be written to the terminal
Returns
The number of bytes that have been written, -1 if an error occured
- (bool) SendDataAsync: (NSData *)  Data

Send a data buffer asynchronously.

This method writes the NSData object provided in argument on the output stream of the SPP channel. It returns immediately whatever the length of the data is. The data buffer is provided to the ICSPP class which sends it asynchronously.

Parameters
DataA NSData object containing the data bytes to be written to the terminal
Returns
YES if the NSData object is valid and the SPP channel is available, otherwise NO.
- (int) SendString: (NSString *)  String

Send a text string synchronously on the SPP channel.

This method writes the NSString object provided in argument on the output stream of the SPP channel. The text is written asynchronously like for SendData method, which means that the application should check if the returned length is equal to the length of the string, otherwise, other calls to SendString would be necessary to send the remaining part.

Parameters
StringA NSString object containing the data bytes to be written to the terminal
Returns
The number of bytes that have been written
- (bool) SendStringAsync: (NSString *)  String

Send a text string asynchronously on the SPP channel.

This method asynchronously writes the NSString object provided in argument on the output stream of the SPP channel. The NSString object is written in one time and the application has not to call this method more than once.

Parameters
StringA NSString object containing the data bytes to be written to the terminal
Returns
YES if the NSString object is valid and the SPP channel is available, otherwise NO.

Field Documentation

- (NSMutableArray*) m_SendList
protected

List to send

Property Documentation

- (id<ICISMPDeviceDelegate, ICISMPDeviceExtensionDelegate>) delegate
readwritenonatomicassign

The delegate of an ICISMPDeviceExtension object.

This property conforms to the ICISMPDeviceDelegate and ICISMPDeviceExtensionDelegate protocols, which means that the assigned object will receive the events of ICISMPDevice and ICISMPDeviceExtension classes.

- (unsigned int) m_ReceiveBufferSize
readwriteatomicassign

Size of received buffer

- (unsigned int) m_TotalNbFrameReceived
readwriteatomicassign

Number of frame received

- (unsigned int) m_TotalNbFrameSent
readwriteatomicassign

Number of frame sent
